title: 'Answer is no': Cong rules out leadership change in K'taka; Siddaramaiah to continue as CM
content: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala, dispatched to Karnataka, has affirmed that Siddaramaiah will remain the Chief Minister, dismissing speculation of leadership change amidst perceived tensions with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar. Minister Priyank Kharge echoed this, stating there is no discontentment and that roles are well-defined within the party. Both Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar have publicly displayed unity, refuting rumors of rifts.

title: TMC minister terms Kolkata rape ‘a small incident’; BJP slams Mamata's ‘depraved regime’
content: The BJP has strongly criticized TMC after a state minister, Manas Bhuniya, seemingly downplayed the alleged gang rape of a law student in Kolkata. Bhuniya's remarks, where he referred to the incident as a 'small' one, sparked outrage. BJP leaders accused TMC of normalizing sexual violence. Bhuniya later clarified, condemning the incident and claiming his words were misrepresented.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill gives major update on Bumrah - 'We'll take the call ...'
content: Ahead of the crucial second Test against England at Edgbaston, India grapple with key selection dilemmas. Jasprit Bumrah's potential inclusion remains uncertain, while captain Shubman Gill hints at strategic changes following their Leeds defeat. The team is considering bolstering their spin attack, possibly including Washington Sundar or Kuldeep Yadav alongside Ravindra Jadeja.

title: 'I was in the room': Jaishankar reveals what PM Modi told Vance when India pounded Pak
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar disclosed that during Operation Sindoor, US Vice President JD Vance warned PM Modi of a potential massive Pakistani assault. Modi remained resolute, signaling a strong response. Following India's retaliation and a subsequent call from Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Pakistan expressed willingness to engage in dialogue.

title: ChatGPT warning: OpenAI CEO asks users not to trust AI ‘much’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Tribunal says police not 'Aladdin ka Chirag'; blames RCB for chaos
content: The Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) has indicated Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) bears primary responsibility for a stampede that killed 11 people. RCB announced victory celebrations without securing necessary police clearance, leading to a massive, unmanaged crowd.

title: OpenAI is shutting down for the next week; CRO Mark Chen warns employees
content: OpenAI is temporarily closing down operations next week. This is to allow employees to rest after long work hours. Meta is trying to recruit OpenAI staff with high salary offers. Mark Chen warned OpenAI staff about Meta's tactics. Meta recently hired some OpenAI researchers. OpenAI is planning to change its compensation strategy.

title: MP girl butchered by jilted lover as hospital staff, patients watch helplessly
content: A shocking incident in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur district has sparked outrage after a Class 12 student, Sandhya Chaudhary, was murdered inside the district hospital. The alleged perpetrator, Abhishek Koshti, a jilted lover, attacked her in broad daylight. Despite the presence of hospital staff, no one intervened. Koshti was arrested shortly after, confessing to the crime, citing suspicion of infidelity.

title: 'Saying I love you isn't sexual harassment': HC draws the line; clears man in Pocso case
content: The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court overturned the conviction of a man under the POSCO Act, stating that expressing 'I love you' doesn't automatically imply sexual intent. The court acquitted the man, who was accused of molesting a teenage girl by holding her hands and professing his love. The bench emphasized that additional evidence is needed to prove a sexual motive beyond the expression of affection.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test: Stokes calls Pant ‘very dangerous’, says England ready to reset
content: Ahead of the crucial second Test at Edgbaston, England captain Ben Stokes has identified Rishabh Pant as a major threat, praising his explosive batting style. Despite holding a 1-0 lead, England remain grounded, naming an unchanged XI. India, meanwhile, aim to rebound after their Leeds defeat, with potential changes in their lineup, setting the stage for a high-stakes encounter.

title: Trump tells Musk to 'go back to South Africa'; slams tesla & SpaceX subsidy dependence
content: Donald Trump has escalated his feud with Elon Musk, threatening to withdraw federal subsidies from Musk's companies and suggesting he return to South Africa. This stems from Musk's criticism of the "Big Beautiful Bill," which Trump supports, and Musk's threat to form a new political party. Musk, in turn, advocates for eliminating all subsidies, even those benefiting his own ventures.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test predicted playing XI: Bumrah to be rested?
content: India fac a selection dilemma for the second Test against England at Edgbaston after their Leeds defeat. With Bumrah likely rested, Siraj, Akash Deep, and Krishna are likely to lead the pace attack. India are expected to include two spinners, with Jadeja a certainty and Washington Sundar favoured for his attacking edge. Nitish Reddy may replace Thakur for batting stability.

title: Tianwen-2 captures Earth and Moon: CNSA shares stunning images
content: China's Tianwen-2 probe has commenced its decade-long deep space mission, capturing a stunning image of Earth and the Moon from 590,000 kilometers away. Launched on May 29, the probe will collect samples from asteroid Kamo’oalewa by 2027 and later investigate comet 311P/PANSTARRS. This dual-target mission aims to unlock secrets about the origin of the Moon, water, and life.

title: Travel at your own risk: Bihar’s Rs100-crore road widened around trees - watch
content: A road widening project between Kanaudi and Irki in Jehanabad, near Patna, has hit a snag, leaving trees standing in the road's center. This poses a safety hazard for commuters. The road, now under the state RCD, awaits forest department clearance to remove the trees.

title: Inside Delhi's death dive squad:102 bodies pulled out from waterbodies this year
content: In Delhi's polluted waters, a team of 15 unsung divers tirelessly recover bodies, often without protective gear. So far in 2025, they've retrieved 102 corpses, facing hazards like toxic chemicals, snake bites, and treacherous currents. Descendants of Yamuna floodplain farmers, diving is their only livelihood after farming was banned due to pollution.

title: Employment Linked Incentive scheme approved for over Rs 3.5 crore jobs
content: The Union Cabinet has approved the Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) Scheme, allocating ₹99,446 crore to generate over 3.5 crore jobs within two years. New employees will receive wage incentives, while employers get support for creating additional jobs, especially in manufacturing.

title: Car stolen in 60 seconds: Delhi gang breaks Creta window, hacks its security
content: Early morning in New Delhi, a Hyundai Creta was stolen in a mere 60 seconds. CCTV footage shows a group arriving in a car, breaking into the vehicle, and hacking its security system.

title: JAC Class 11 results 2025 declared at jacresults.com with 98.7% pass rate
content: The Jharkhand Academic Council (JAC) has declared the Class 11 Annual Examination results for 2025, with over 98.7% of students promoted. The results are available online at jacresults.com. A total of 344,987 students passed out of 349,476 who appeared. Alongside Class 11 results, JAC also announced the Model School Entrance and Intermediate Vocational Course examination results. Detailed statistics on enrolment, promotion, and absenteeism have been released, highlighting strong academic performance across Jharkhand.

title: Maharashtra assembly: Nana Patole climbs speaker's podium; gets suspended
content: Maharashtra assembly witnessed uproar. Congress MLA Nana Patole faced suspension. He protested against BJP leaders' comments on farmers. Opposition parties walked out. They boycotted proceedings. Patole vowed to continue raising farmer issues. He demanded action against BJP leaders Babanrao Lonikar and Manikrao Kokate. Other opposition leaders supported Patole. They criticized the government's handling of farmer concerns.

title: ‘Told me to sing for drunk friends’: Years of harassment by Kolkata rape accused
content: Monojit Mishra, also known as Mango, faces accusations of rape at a law college. Students report his disturbing behavior and constant stares. Eleven cases are registered against Monojit, including molestation charges. Victims describe incidents of harassment and threats. Pramit Mukhopadhyay, a co-accused, is allegedly involved in substance abuse. Students express fear and discomfort due to Monojit's actions.

title: Kareena Kapoor Khan gets candid on carrying the Kapoor legacy
content: Karisma Kapoor was the first one who came forward and rose to stardom from the great Kapoor family when it had been carried by only men from the royal family for a very long time. After she broke the tradition of male actors from the Kapoor family enjoying the stardom, her sister Kareena Kapoor also tried her luck in the industry.

title: 'Pushed her from 32nd floor after fight': Bhandup teen’s death mistaken as suicide
content: A 17-year-old's death in Bhandup, initially treated as suicide, is now a murder case. Police investigation revealed inconsistencies in the statement of the deceased's minor friend, the prime suspect. CCTV footage showed them together on the terrace.

title: Tamil Nadu custodial death: Vijay demands SIT probe
content: The death of Ajith Kumar, a temple guard, in police custody in Tamil Nadu has triggered widespread outrage, prompting actor Vijay to demand a special investigation. Evidence presented in court suggests Kumar was tortured, leading to the arrest of five police officers.

title: 'Sometimes the best moments...': Neeraj's heartwarming exchange with senior citizen - watch
content: Neeraj Chopra, during a Bengaluru stroll, shared a heartwarming moment with an admirer who expressed immense respect for his achievements. The interaction, captured in a reel, highlighted Chopra's humility. The Neeraj Chopra Classic, India's first international javelin competition, is set for July 5th at the Sree Kanteerava Stadium.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo signs $700 million deal with Al Nassr
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's move to Al Nassr includes a staggering $700 million deal, complete with private jets and a 16-member personal staff. Beyond the massive salary, Ronaldo benefits from perks like signing bonuses, goal-scoring incentives, and ownership in the club. Lionel Messi and David Beckham have also received similar lucrative extras in their contracts.

title: Najeeb Ahmed case to be closed: Missing JNU student's mother slams CBI for negligence
content: Fatima Nafis, the mother of missing JNU student Najeeb Ahmed, has accused the CBI and Delhi Police of negligence after a Delhi court allowed the closure of her son's case, who disappeared in October 2016. She alleges inaction against ABVP members involved in a scuffle with Najeeb before his disappearance.

title: Bihar shocker: Man dies trying to save buffaloes from Vande Bharat Express
content: In a tragic incident near Sheikhpura, a 50-year-old man lost his life while attempting to save two buffaloes from the Varanasi-Deoghar Vande Bharat Express. Gopal Yadav's heroic effort to rescue the animals proved fatal when the high-speed train struck all three. The collision's impact scattered remains along the tracks, briefly disrupting train services on the Nawada-Kiul section.

title: ITR:Why filing tax return is important even if you have no tax to pay - explained
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Filing an ITR is more than just a tax obligation; it is a way to establish your financial presence, ensure transparency, claim rightful refunds, and meet compliance requirements in an interconnected world.

title: Southern Europe roasts as temperatures soar
content: Paris was put on red alert for extreme heat and Spain and Portugal reported record temperatures on Monday as a heatwave across southern Europe triggered health warnings and fuelled wildfires. Seven regions in central and southern Portugal, including the capital Lisbon, were placed on red alert for the second day running Monday, with fire warnings in many forested areas.

title: Body in garbage truck: How techie’s sharp eye exposed woman’s murder by live-in partner
content: In Bengaluru, a 32-year-old man, Shamsuddin, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his live-in partner, Asha. He strangled her after an argument at their rented home. Shamsuddin then transported her body on a scooter to Banashankari, where he dumped it in a garbage truck. A techie discovered the body, alerting the police.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Suspension of IPS officer Vikash revoked
content: The Central Administrative Tribunal has cancelled the suspension of senior IPS officer Vikas Kumar. He was suspended after the Bengaluru stampede incident. The tribunal cited a lack of specific evidence against Kumar. It also urged the government to review the suspensions of other officials. The stampede occurred outside Chinnaswamy Stadium on June 4.

title: IND vs ENG: To play Bumrah or not? Ravi Shastri offers his suggestion
content: Ravi Shastri urges India to respond strongly in the second Test against England at Edgbaston after their narrow defeat in the first Test. Shastri emphasised the importance of resilience and immediate action, hoping for Jasprit Bumrah's inclusion. He also reflected on Shubman Gill's captaincy debut, highlighting the need for proactive leadership and team support to level the series.

title: 'Would head back to South Africa': Trump threatens Musk - DOGE may haunt Elon now
content: Donald Trump retaliated against Elon Musk, asserting that the Tesla CEO relies heavily on American government subsidies and would likely return to South Africa without them. Trump criticized the EV mandate, while Musk condemned Trump's spending bill, threatening to form a new political party in response. The dispute highlights contrasting views on government support and political direction.

title: Railways launches new ‘super app’: Book train tickets, track PNR in one place
content: Indian Railways has introduced 'RailOne,' a comprehensive app designed to streamline passenger services. This superapp integrates various functionalities, including ticket booking for reserved, unreserved, and platform tickets, PNR tracking, train status updates, coach positioning etc.

title: Thai PM suspended over leaked call with ex-Cambodian leader- what were they discussing?
content: Thailand's Constitutional Court suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra following a leaked phone call with a former Cambodian leader, sparking public discontent and protests. The leaked audio revealed her critical remarks about a Thai military official and assurances to Hun Sen. Amidst the controversy, a cabinet reshuffle was approved to stabilize the coalition government.

title: Tamil Nadu: 7 killed in explosion at firecracker factory; injured rushed to hospital
content: A devastating explosion at a firecracker factory near Sivakasi, Tamil Nadu, has resulted in the tragic loss of at least four lives. Five individuals sustained injuries in the incident and are currently receiving medical care at a government hospital in Virudhunagar. Authorities are investigating the cause of the explosion at the factory in Chinnakamanpatti.

title: Karnataka 2nd PUC Exam 3 result 2025 declared, only 22% students pass
content: KSEAB has declared the Karnataka 2nd PUC Exam 3 results for 2025, with only 22% of students passing out of 82,683 candidates. Over 11,900 students improved their scores, a rise from last year’s 7,420. Students can check results online from 1 PM on July 1. The overall consolidated pass rate, including repeaters and private candidates, stands at 79.81%, with 5,66,636 students passing out of 7,09,968 total.

title: Miyaan Magic! Siraj joins Kohli with off-field venture - complete details
content: Indian cricketer Mohammed Siraj has launched his first restaurant, Joharfa, in Hyderabad, offering a diverse menu of Mughlai, Persian, Arabian, and Chinese dishes. Siraj expressed that Joharfa is close to his heart, aiming to provide a place for people to enjoy flavours that feel like home.

title: Chess | 'He was treated badly' - Anish Giri defends Hans Nieman
content: Anish Giri, the Dutch Grandmaster, supports Hans Niemann amidst cheating claims. Giri expresses his frustration over the lack of evidence against Niemann. He feels Niemann's treatment was unjust. Giri highlights the complex relationships among top chess players. He describes it as a mix of rivalry, friendship, respect, and a desire to win.

title: Telangana factory tragedy: Toll rises to 40; many workers still missing
content: A massive explosion at a Sigachi Industries chemical plant in Telangana's Medak district has claimed 40 lives, with fears the toll may rise. A dryer malfunction is suspected to have triggered the blast, which reduced the facility to rubble. Rescue operations are ongoing, complicated by a lack of information on the number of workers present.

title: Shefali case: Pooja reveals Parag was ‘questioned’ by the police, says, 'no foul play'
content: The television industry mourns the sudden death of actress Shefali Jariwala, who passed away at 42 due to cardiac arrest. Friend Pooja Ghai revealed that police questioned Shefali's husband, Parag, immediately following her death. Ghai emphasized that the autopsy confirmed no foul play, relieving concerns of a prolonged investigation. The funeral took place with family and industry friends in attendance.

title: IPL: 'Cameraman manages to find me', Kavya Maran on her memes
content: Kavya Maran, CEO of Sunrisers Hyderabad, has addressed her viral reactions during IPL matches, attributing them to her deep personal investment in the team's performance. Under her leadership, SRH has experienced fluctuating success, including a bottom finish in 2023 and a second-place finish in 2024. Maran also oversees the successful Sunrisers Eastern Cape in SA20.

title: AKTU One View result 2025 released for odd semester UG and PG courses
content: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University (AKTU), Lucknow, has released the One View Result 2025 for odd semester UG and PG programmes, including BTech, MCA, MTech, BFAD, and more. The provisional results are available online at aktu.ac.in and include regular and carry-over exam outcomes. Students must enter their roll number to access the marksheet. Official mark sheets will be issued later. The announcement follows the earlier release of odd semester results in the year.

title: NBA free agency grades: Hawks, Rockets make early splashes; Grizzlies' Jackson lands $240M extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings and extensions, including early summer winners in Houston, Atlanta and Memphis.

title: Sources: Nuggets trading MPJ to Nets for Johnson
content: The Nuggets will trade Michael Porter Jr. and an unprotected 2032 first-round pick to the Nets for Cam Johnson, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Mavs agree to $13M deal with PG Russell
content: Free agent point guard D'Angelo Russell has agreed to a two-year, $13 million deal with the Dallas Mavericks, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Pegula handed early Wimbledon exit by No. 116
content: Italy's Elisabetta Cocciaretto registered the biggest win of her career when she knocked out American Jessica Pegula, the No. 3 seed, in less than an hour at Wimbledon.

title: Raleigh belts No. 33, serenaded with 'MVP' chants
content: Cal Raleigh hit his 33rd homer to become the fifth player in MLB history to reach that total before July, joining Ken Griffey Jr., Sammy Sosa, Mark McGwire and Barry Bonds.

title: Abreu hits grand slam, inside-the-park HR for Sox
content: Wilyer Abreu hit a grand slam and an inside-the-park solo home run for the Boston Red Sox on Monday in a rousing 13-6 victory over the Cincinnati Reds at Fenway Park, and according to ESPN Research, he's the first player to pull off the feat since 1958.

title: Ibrahimovic: 'Messi plays with statues' at Miami
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic defended Lionel Messi following Inter Miami's elimination from the FIFA Club World Cup and likened the superstar's teammates to "statues."

title: Sources: Hawks land Alexander-Walker, Kennard
content: The Hawks are acquiring Nickeil Alexander-Walker from the Timberwolves via a sign-and-trade for four years and $62 million, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Monday. In addition, Atlanta reached a one-year, $11 million deal with Luke Kennard.

title: Sources: Clarkson expected to sign with Knicks
content: Jordan Clarkson is expected to sign with the Knicks after he clears free agency waivers, sources said Monday.

title: 💰Bobby Bonilla Day! Another $1.19M from Mets
content: Bobby Bo hasn't played for the Mets since 1999, but Tuesday he'll receive his annual hefty check from the team.

title: Free agency preview: How each team can earn an A-plus
content: With the market opening Tuesday, we identify key free agents for each club -- and what each GM should do.

title: Man City's old vulnerabilities exposed in Al Hilal upset
content: Pep Guardiola and Co. will have much to ponder ahead of the Premier League season after underdogs Al Hilal sensationally knocked Man City out of the Club World Cup.

title: If a bunch of Americans transfer to better clubs, will it solve the USMNT's problems?
content: With the 2026 FIFA World Cup less than a year away, how important is it USMNT players transfer to better clubs or find clubs where they can play more?

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: NFL players are busy reading these authors, from Tolstoy to Belichick
content: A.J. Brown made reading cool after his viral moment on the bench in January. But what are other NFL players reading this summer?

title: 'I always wanted to follow in my dad's footsteps': Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: Caitlin Clark's status, 3-pointers and fast-break points: Keys to Tuesday's Commissioner's Cup final
content: Minnesota has set the bar for consistency this season. Indiana? Not so much. And Caitlin Clark's status is uncertain.

title: What to know about WNBA expansion to Cleveland, Detroit and Philadelphia
content: Why is the WNBA expanding now? How will it impact the CBA and draft? What will more roster spots and NBA ownership mean?

title: Al Hilal eliminate Manchester City in CWC stunner
content: Saudi club Al Hilal pulled off a surprise upset on Monday, defeating Manchester City 4-3 in extra time in Orlando to advance to the quarterfinals of the Club World Cup.

title: Lautaro rips Inter after CWC exit: 'Fight, or leave'
content: Inter captain Lautaro Martínez sharply criticized his team's lack of commitment and performance after the 2-0 loss against Fluminense in the Club World Cup round of 16.

title: 'Big possibility' Mbappé plays for Madrid vs. Juve
content: Kylian Mbappé is close to making his FIFA Club World Cup debut in Real Madrid's round of 16 clash against Juventus at the Club World Cup, with coach Xabi Alonso saying it is a "big possibility" that the forward will be fit to play.

title: FIFPRO: U.S. temps a concern for '26 World Cup
content: FIFPRO has raised concerns over the effect of intense heat during the FIFA Club World Cup in the United States by saying that two games -- Paris Saint-Germain-Atlético Madrid and Chelsea-Esperance -- should have been postponed due to extreme heat.

title: Torrent: Time with Pep key vs. 'superior' Dortmund
content: Monterrey head coach Domenec Torrent admitted his team faces a superior opponent in Borussia Dortmund in the Club World Cup round of 16 on Tuesday night at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, but he expects the Liga MX side to compete well.

title: Neymar to play until 'I can no longer perform'
content: Brazil forward Neymar has said he will continue playing football until he can 'no longer perform' as he wants to.

title: Liverpool's Hinds leaves club amid Arsenal talks
content: Liverpool Women have confirmed vice-captain Taylor Hinds has decided to leave the club, with a source telling ESPN she is in talks with Arsenal.

title: Premier League kit rankings: Every new jersey released so far
content: Why should you have to wait until all of the Premier League kits are out before you see them ranked? Here's every 2025-26 jersey that's been released.

title: The Mock Draft project: 2025's most wanted fantasy football picks
content: We put our experts through the paces of multiple mock drafts to derive the ultimate average draft positions for 2025.

title: What the trade to Steelers means for Jonnu Smith's value
content: Smith had a breakout year in Miami last season. Will he do it again after being traded to the Steelers?

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Is Jake Paul finally in the cruiserweight top 10?
content: Jake Paul took one more step toward challenging for his first world title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'This is a startup': Meet the man in charge of policing the new world of college sports
content: Overseeing athlete payments in college sports may seem like a thankless, nearly impossible job. But Bryan Seeley thinks he's up to the task.

title: Married in Manhattan: Zach Wilson ties knot with Nicolette Dellanno in New York
content: Quarterback Zach Wilson got married over the weekend to Nicolette Dellanno a year after their engagement.

title: 2026 NFL mock draft: Miller's early projections for the first round, including four QBs
content: What might the Browns and Rams do with their first-rounders? How many QBs could go on Day 1? Here's Matt Miller's early look at the 2026 draft.

title: Fight grades: UFC 317 was the best pay-per-view of 2025
content: UFC 317 gets the best report card of the year so far. It was all-around entertaining and included one near-perfect fight.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make move for Palace's Eze
content: Arsenal could make a move for Crystal Palace forward Eberechi Eze. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Two fishing boats adrift in Sri Lankan waters rescued along with 20 crew members on board
content: The fishermen and their families thank the District Collector, officials of the Department of Fisheries, Indian Coast Guard and the Thoothukudi fishermen for their swift response

title: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy visits pharma blast site, announces ₹1 crore ex-gratia for victims’ families
content: The CM ordered officials to identify those responsible and take stringent action against them and directed officials to submit a detailed report on the incident and conduct inspections in other chemical companies to identify shortcomings and prevent such accidents

title: Collector stresses on micro-level flood preparedness measures in Eluru district
content: To ensure real-time responsiveness, a 24x7 control room will be set up and mandal-level WhatsApp groups formed for emergency alerts

title: Surjewala rules out leadership change, says he is in Karnataka only to gather info on work done by MLAs
content: ‘Some of you asked me are you taking opinion on leadership change. The answer I had given yesterday also and I am answering again today - the answer is clearly ‘no’ in one word’

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: After prolonged delay, Kottayam Science City all set to open
content: Science Centre, the first phase of the project, will start functioning. The Science Centre building houses science galleries on fun science, marine life and science, and emerging technology

title: Government to upgrade 5,000 mini anganwadis, recruit 5,000 helpers in Andhra Pradesh, says Minister Sandhya Rani
content: The salaries of outsourced workers in schools run by the Andhra Pradesh Tribal Welfare Residential Educational Institutions Society will soon be increased, she says

title: NCB busts top darknet-based drug vendor; seizes drugs and cryptocurrency
content: The ‘high-impact operation’ led by the Narcotics Control Bureau’s Kochi zonal unit resulted in the seizure of large quantities of LSD and ketamine, and digital assets worth ₹70 lakh

title: Shivakumar says no talks on leadership change in Karnataka, asks party leaders not to speak to media
content: D K Shivakumar said a notice will be issued to Ramanagara MLA H A Iqbal Hussain, who has been making statements that Shivakumar should become the CM.

title: 91 per cent NTR Bharosa pensions distributed in Eluru district
content: Beneficiaries who did not receive their pensions on July 1 due to some reason would be offered them on Wednesday, says Collector

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan extends financial aid to Telugu actor Vasuki
content: Popularly known by her screen name ‘Pakeeja’, she says that this act of kindness will stay with her forever

title: Karnataka government should drop Devanahalli land acquisition: Baraguru Ramachandrappa
content: Writes must raise their voice to preserve their conscience and record their resistance to spread ideas among others, he says

title: South Calcutta Law College students, Alipore Court lawyers stage protests over gang rape
content: Students organised the protest in front of the college, holding placards and raising slogans for justice, and stressed the need for comprehensive reforms in the governing body of the institute.

title: Coal Ministry to launch digital exploration module on July 4
content: According to the Ministry, the SWCS web portal is developed in collaboration with the Central Mine Planning and Design Institute Limited (CMPDIL)

title: After NICE Road, toll hiked on Bengaluru–Nelamangala section of NH4, irked commuters call it ‘unfair’
content: Starting July 1, toll rates have been revised on several major stretches in Bengaluru, including the NICE Road and the Bengaluru Elevated Tollway connecting Central Silk Board to Electronics City and extending up to Attibele near the Karnataka–Tamil Nadu border.

title: 'Maulana' Tejashwi Yadav playing communal politics, sensing defeat in upcoming Bihar polls: BJP
content: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia alleged that they want to gain the power to bring Sharia law for the empowerment of one particular community only, unlike the NDA which works for the progress of all sections of society

title: Citizens should register themselves as voters only in constituencies they are ordinary residents: Chief Election Commissioner
content: His remarks come as the poll machinery in Bihar undertakes a special intensive review (SIR) of the voters list of the state, which is going to the polls later this year.

title: Militaries of India, France hold joint drills
content: About 50 armoured and tactical vehicles and fighter jets were deployed in the Indo-French army exercise Shakti that was held from June 18 to July 1

title: Election Commission's clarification on Bihar electoral rolls revision confusing, misleading: CPI(ML) Liberation
content: "Rather than asking people to excavate past records, let the state ensure universal registration of births and deaths to ensure automatic updating of records," CPI(ML) Liberation leader Dipankar Bhattacharya said.

title: Parents of Tiruppur dowry harassment victim meet Edappadi Palaniswami
content: They claimed that the accused’s family and relatives are in the Congress party and the police are allegedly helping them to escape from the case.

title: South Calcutta Law College expels three accused in gang rape of student
content: The college authorities have also decided to apply for the cancellation of the bar council membership of Monojit Mishra who is a practising criminal lawyer

title: Modi government's 'lofty' claims about Digital India marred by 'unfulfilled promises': Kharge
content: remarks came after the Prime Minister stated that the Digital India initiative bridged the digital divide between haves and have-nots

title: Mandatory guide rule for treks in Sohra following tourist deaths
content: East Khasi Hills administration introduces “no guide, no trek” directive to enhance visitor safety in Meghalaya’s popular tourism zone

title: Nature classroom on wheels: Eco-Savaari to strengthen environmental stewardship among students across Karnataka
content: The programme aims to reach over 300 schools across Karnataka, delivering region-specific and practical conservation knowledge to promote positive human-nature interactions and awareness.

title: Kolkata gang rape case: Police warn of action against attempts to reveal victim's identity
content: The city police cautioned that sharing any material, including documents, images or social media content that could directly or indirectly reveal the identity of the victim is punishable under relevant legal provisions.

title: RailOne App launched: From booking IRCTC tickets to checking train status, check key features of the ‘super app’
content: The RailOne app will consolidate all passenger services into a single platform. Check key features here

title: Mizoram University gets A+ grade in latest NAAC accreditation
content: Vice Chancellor Dibakar C. Deka said it was a remarkable achievement for the university in its Silver Jubilee year

title: Kisan Sabha demands amendments to Wildlife Act, threatens action if Union govt. fails to act
content: AIKS demands wildlife act amendments to protect farmers, criticises government policies, plans national strike and solidarity campaign.

title: Madras High Court dismisses plea to quiz Annamalai in Anna University sexual assault case
content: Justice P. Velmurugan advises the petitioner to ignore statements made by politicians in connection with criminal cases

title: Indian Navy Commissions Stealth Frigate INS Tamal In Russia
content: Indian Navy's Russian-manufactured guided missile frigate INS Tamal that features an array of guns, surveillance systems and BrahMos supersonic missile was commissioned into the force in Russia's coastal city of Kaliningrad.

title: Air India Delhi-Vienna Flight Plunged 900 Feet Mid-Air, Days After Ahmedabad Crash
content: An Air India flight took off from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport for Vienna on June 14. However, soon after takeoff, it lost altitude - the plane dropped 900 feet mid-air.

title: "Heritage Not Disturbed": Court Rejects Pleas Against Thackeray Memorial
content: The Bombay High Court dismissed multiple petitions challenging the Maharashtra government's decision to convert the Mayor's Bungalow at Shivaji Park into a memorial for late Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray.

title: 92-Year-Old UK Man Jailed For Life Over 1967 Rape And Murder
content: A 92-year-old British man was on Tuesday jailed for life for a 1967 rape and murder, in the UK's oldest solved cold case.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Leads Key Experiment To Decode Muscle Loss In Space
content: IAF Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla has undertaken a key experiment to decode muscle health in space -- crucial for astronauts undertaking long space missions as well as for people with muscle loss on Earth.

title: "We Are Very Close With India": US On Trade Deal: Report
content: The U.S. and India are nearing a deal to lower tariffs on American imports to the South Asian country and to help India avoid levies imposed by the Trump administration rising sharply next week.

title: Delhi Retired Government Employee Duped Of Rs 14 Lakh In Digital Arrest Scam
content: Two men were arrested for allegedly duping a retired government employee of Rs 14 lakh by posing as cybercrime officials and threatening him with a fabricated digital arrest in north Delhi, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Weather Office Predicts Heavy Rain Over Next 6-7 Days Across India
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said very heavy rainfall is expected in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan over some of the next six to seven days.

title: FIR Can Be Registered On Complaint Sent By Email From Abroad: High Court
content: The Kerala High Court has held that the police cannot refuse to register a first information report (FIR) merely because a complaint was sent via email from abroad without a signature.

title: Israel Army Says Reviewing Deadly Strike On Seafront Gaza Cafe
content: The Israeli army said Tuesday that it launched a review into a strike on a seafront Gaza cafe it says targeted militants, but which rescuers said killed 24 people. The army said it had struck "several Hamas terrorists in the northern Gaza Strip".

title: Amazon 'Applauds' Canada's Scrapping Of Tech Tax
content: Amazon said Tuesday it "applauds" Canada's decision to scrap its digital services tax in order to salvage trade talks with the United States, calling it a win for the online retailer's customers.

title: Cloudbursts, Landslides In Himachal Pradesh, 1 Dead, Many Missing In Mandi
content: Heavy and incessant rains in Himachal Pradesh over the past few days have resulted in multiple incidents of building collapse, landslides, as well as widespread road blockages at multiple locations.

title: End Of The Line For King Charles' Royal Train
content: King Charles has decided to scrap Britain's royal train, a service dating back to Queen Victoria, because it is no longer cost-effective.

title: Donald Trump's Foreign Aid Cut Risks Causing 14 Million Deaths: Study
content: More than 14 million of the world's most vulnerable people, a third of them small children, could die by 2030 because of the Trump administration's dismantling of US foreign aid, research projected on Tuesday.

title: Families Of Air India Crash Victims May File Cases Against Airline In UK, US Courts
content: Legal teams from the US and the UK are preparing to file lawsuits against Boeing in the two countries over the Air India crash in Ahmedabad last month, in one of the worst aviation disasters the country has seen, sources have told NDTV.

title: Kremlin Denies US Claims That Russia Was Stalling In 'Peace Talks'
content: The Kremlin on Tuesday denied claims by U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy for Ukraine that Russia was stalling in peace talks, adding that Moscow had fulfilled all the agreements reached so far in the negotiations.

title: USAID Cancelled Rape Survivor Kits For Congo Amid Rising Conflict
content: US President Donald Trump's administration cancelled a major contract to supply emergency kits for rape survivors in Congo as violence surged in the east this year, leaving thousands without access to life-saving medication.

title: Iran-Linked Hackers Threatens To Leak Trump Aides' Emails
content: Iran-linked hackers have threatened to disclose more emails stolen from U.S. President Donald Trump's circle, after distributing a prior batch to the media ahead of the 2024 U.S. election.

title: Most World Heritage Sites At Risk Of Drought Or Flooding: UN
content: Almost three quarters of the globe's cultural and natural heritage sites are threatened by too little or too much water, the UN's cultural agency said on Tuesday.

title: Air India Crash Preliminary Report Next Week, Will Outline Possible Causes
content: The preliminary probe report on the Air India crash, in which at least 270 people were killed - including 241 on board the flight - is expected to be released by July 11 and will outline the possible causes.

title: Kerala veterinary student ragging case: HC directs govt to deposit ₹7 lakh as compensation to family
content: High Court questions delay in filing petition against State Human Rights Commission's order and instructed Kerala govt to submit detailed affidavit explaining reasons for delay

title: Union Cabinet approves National Sports Policy 2025
content: National Sports Policy is a landmark initiative aimed at reshaping the country’s sporting landscape and empowering citizens through sports.

title: A historic boat sold as scrap being restored in Kochi
content: Seethi Sajar is restoring the boat used by the late British harbour engineer Sir Robert Charles Bristow who founded the Willingdon Island. He bought a 3-acre plot at Karuvelippady to construct a fibre glass enclosure for displaying the historic boat. He plans to have it ready for public viewing by Onam.

title: Sivaganga custodial death case: Video of police torture emerges
content: The victim, Ajith Kumar was being interrogated for an alleged theft of about 10 sovereign gold ornaments from a devotee’s car that he helped park at the temple premises on June 27

title: Union Cabinet approves four-lane Paramakudi - Ramanathapuram road project in Tamil Nadu
content: The project will be developed on Hybrid Annuity Mode (HAM) at a capital cost of ₹1,853 crore, I&B Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: ‘Silence is not neutrality, speak up’: Karnataka activists and intellectuals write open letter to industry and tech leaders
content: The letter appealed to Bengaluru’s industry and tech leaders to seek from the State government a thorough review of the Devanahalli acquisition and support a broader public dialogue on Karnataka’s land-acquisition policy.

title: NoRKA-Roots organises campaign to create awareness on various ID cards for expats from Kerala
content: The various ID cards are helpful for the government in locating expatriate Keralites around the world and intervening in times of need.

title: Farmers demonstrate against land survey for Shaktipeeth expressway project
content: Agitating farmers expressed concerns over the acquisition of their fertile land for the 802-kilometre greenfield, access-controlled, six-lane corridor that will connect central and western Maharashtra to Goa

title: Union Cabinet approves Research Development and Innovation Scheme
content: RDI Scheme aims to provide long-term financing or refinancing with long tenors at low or nil interest rates to spur private sector investment

title: Malayalam actor Minu Muneer arrested for defamatory posts against Balachandra Menon, released on bail
content: Minu Muneer surrenders at cybercrime police station in Kochi after Kerala High Court dismissed her anticipatory bail plea and directed her to appear before the police. She was later released on bail as per the direction of court

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court orders NEET-UG retest for candidates affected by power cuts at exam centres
content: Madhya Pradesh HC directed the NTA to conduct the examination as expeditiously as possible for the affected candidates and declare the results, making it clear that the petitioners’ rank, based solely on their scores in the retest, should be considered

title: Madras High Court permits renovation works at Kancheepuram Devarajaswamy Temple
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh records the submission of temple management that ramps were being constructed for the benefit of the aged and differently-abled devotees

title: Flood situation in Odisha’s Balasore critical, 100 villages impacted
content: The Balasore Collector along with senior officials visited and monitored the present flood situation in Basta, Jaleswar, Baliapal and Bhograi, an official release issued by the district administration said.

title: Freedom fighter Ayyaroth Kunhikannan Nambiar dies at 104 in Kerala
content: He was actively part of various protests organised under the aegis of Indian National Congress during freedom movement

title: Indian Navy contains fire on board Palau-flagged tanker with 14 Indian crew
content: The Navy swung into action and launched the fire-fighting operation after receiving a distress call from the vessel on June 29, 2025.

title: Namakkal restaurants stop supply of food to online delivery platforms Swiggy, Zomato
content: Though hidden charges and advertisements, these aggregator companies announce flat offers that result in big losses for the restaurant owners, says a restauranteur.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Tribunal quashes suspension of IPS Officer Vikash Kumar, says RCB responsible for larger gathering
content: Central Administrative Tribunal says the suspension order has been passed in a mechanical manner and that the police officers have been suspended ‘without any sufficient material or grounds’

title: Leopard that spread panic in Kerala’s Wayanad caught, moved to care centre
content: It had attacked and killed several domestic animals, was sighted on the road and in car porch of a house

title: Student ends life in residential school in Parkal
content: The girl’s father alleged harassment by teachers in his complaint, although no note was left behind by the girl and incidents of alleged depression were being looked into.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Pilgrims make beeline for registration in Jammu
content: The 38-day pilgrimage will commence from the twin tracks —  the traditional 48-km long Nunwan-Pahalgam route in Anantnag district and the 14-km shorter but steeper Baltal route in Ganderbal district — on July 3.

title: Supreme Court introduces reservation for staff
content: According to the policy, the quota benefits will be available to registrars, senior personal assistants, assistant librarians, junior court assistants and chamber attendants

title: Gas leakage from tanker reported in Jharkhand, vehicular movement stopped on highway
content: Gas leakage on Baharagora-Baripada highway prompts traffic stoppage; officials work to control situation and alert residents

title: A.P. Industries Minister Bharath reviews development works at Kurnool GH
content: Minister Bharath asked officials to ensure there is no power cut in the hospital and also provide UPS connection to AMC, Gynic OT, and super speciality OTs.

title: Nana Patole climbs Speaker’s podium to protest BJP MLAs’ remarks, suspended for a day
content: Congress MLA Nana Patole demanded action against BJP MLA Babanrao Lonikar and Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate for “insulting” farmers; he was seen arguing with Speaker Rahul Narwekar on the podium

title: 12 sentenced to life imprisonment in 18-year-old violence and murder case in Uttar Pradesh’s Barabanki
content: Special Additional Sessions Judge (SC/ST Act) Veena Narayan pronounced the verdict on Monday (June 30, 2025), holding the 12 accused guilty of murder, attempt to murder, arson, rioting and offences under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act

title: Kerala’s FYUGP curriculum is student-centric, says Higher Education Minister R. Bindu
content: Bindu says framework was prepared keeping in mind need to change character of students from passive recipients, who accept one-sided monologues of teachers, to active producers of knowledge

title: PDP's protest march against J&K Govt. thwarted by police, several leaders detained
content: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti slammed the detention of party leaders, saying, “It appears that the administration only flexes its might when it comes to foiling PDP protests.”

title: Former Kerala CM V.S. Achuthanandan remains in critical condition
content: Achuthanandan continues to be in ICU and there has not been any significant improvement in his condition though he seemed to respond to medications

title: Govt extends tenure of FSIB chairman, other members by one year
content: The Financial Services Institutions Bureau  is headed by Bhanu Pratap Sharma, former secretary of Department of Personnel and Training.

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Case transferred to CB-CID, SP Ashish Rawat shifted without posting
content: Earlier, five policemen were arrested and charged with murder based on post-mortem and inquest report. While Nainar Nagenthran of Tamil Nadu BJP has sought NHRC probe, Vijay of TVK demanded the constitution of SIT

title: The unexpectedly polite Chandrahara dessert war, now on in Bengaluru
content: The 1954 movie Chandraharam may have been forgotten, but its name lives on through this layered pastry dessert from Karnataka which was invented by the iconic MTR restaurant. Now, India Sweet House is making it too

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan condoles Telangana factory blast deaths
content: In a post on X, Pinarayi Vijayan said: ‘Deeply saddened by the tragic chemical factory blast in Telangana. Our thoughts are with the bereaved families and all those affected. Kerala stands in solidarity’

title: Search operations underway to arrest gunmen in Churachandpur ambush: Manipur Police
content: The United Kuki National Army, a banned militant outfit, claimed responsibility for the attack which killed four people

title: Priyadarshini Mattoo case: Delhi High Court sets aside decision to reject convict's plea for premature release
content: Priyadarshini Mattoo was raped and murdered in January 1996; Santosh Kumar Singh, a law student of Delhi University, was acquitted by the trial court in the case on December 3, 1999, but the Delhi High Court had on October 27, 2006, reversed the decision, holding him guilty of rape and murder and awarded him death penalty; in October 2010, the Supreme Court had upheld Singh’s conviction but commuted the death sentence to life imprisonment

title: Six workers killed, five injured in explosion at firecracker unit near Sivakasi
content: Initial reports suggest that friction that occurred while handling chemicals during the making of aerial fireworks goods could have led to the accident.

title: Sandalwood tree worth lakhs stolen from varsity Lucknow V-C’s official residence
content: The incident that occurred at the official residence of the King George's Medical University Vice-Chancellor is being investigated under the Forest Act.

title: ‘Break their legs and take reward’: Odisha IPS officer’s instruction during Congress protests over Puri stampede sparks row
content: The controversy erupted after a purported video, in which Bhubaneswar Additional Police Commissioner Narasingha Bhol was seen instructing police personnel to “break their legs and take reward from me” during a Congress workers’ protest

title: Two killed, five injured in collision on MC Road in Kerala’s Kottayam
content: Incident occurred around 12.30 am when a four-wheeler, heading towards Kottayam from Manippuzha, collided with a pickup van from opposite direction

title: PM running away from Manipur situation, Trump’s claims: Congress jabs Modi ahead of tour
content: Prime Minister Modi will embark on a five-nation tour beginning July 2 to participate in the BRICS Summit in Brazil and expand India's ties with several key nations of the Global South.

title: Gross oversimplification, misleading to make India-U.S. relations about China: Jaishankar
content: Mr. Jaishankar said that the India-U.S. relationship is about “so many other things,” noting the large Indian community, which contributes significantly to the U.S.

title: Technology reduced divides instead of deepening them: PM Modi
content: Modi marked the 10-year anniversary of the Digital India programme in a LinkedIn post where he said that digitisation has cut out middlemen and reduced “the gap between the haves and have-nots”.

title: Fresh protest over sea incursion at Chellanam in Kerala
content: Chellanam-Kochi Janakeeya Vedhi demands that second phase construction of tetrapod-based seawall cover the remaining affected coastal stretch in Chellanam panchayat in one go and not in a piecemeal manner

title: JSP leaders demand stern action against a hotelier for mimicking Tirupala temple design
content: The leaders alleged that there was an outrage among the devotees, as non-vegetarian food was also being served at the controversial hotel

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests seven Indian fishermen from Rameswaram
content: Around 11 p.m. a boat was held by Sri Lanka as it had allegedly crossed the International Maritime Boundary Line.

title: Andhra Pradesh launches ‘Digi-Lakshmi’ scheme to empower urban poor women
content: More than 9,000 Common Service Centres will set up across all Urban Local Bodies as part of the scheme, offering around 250 public services

title: A govt officer in Odisha found to have acquired 84 acre of land
content: Vigilance directorate has also traced other high valued properties in Bhubaneswar and Nabarangpur towns

title: India-U.S. trade deal: Two countries need to find common ground; will have to watch this space for next few days, says Jaishankar
content: “And just like the U.S. or people in the U.S. may have views about India, people in India have views about the U.S. too. And we’ll have to find a kind of meeting ground. I believe it’s possible,” Mr. Jaishankar said

title: 26 patients evacuated after minor fire at burns ward in State-run Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru
content: The fire is suspected to have originated from a short circuit in a switch board; all 26 patients, including five in the ICU shifted to H-Block of the hospital for uninterrupted care.

title: Akali Dal accuses AAP of resorting to political vendetta; AAP hits back
content: In the meeting of the party’s core committee held in Chandigarh, which was presided over by party president Sukhbir Singh Badal, it was announced that the party would start a people’s campaign against the corruption and scams prevailing in the government.

title: Los Angeles Lakers unveil Statement Edition uniforms for 2025-26 season
content: the lakers announced their new statement edition uniform for the 2025-26 season on monday . the uniform also used a purple base, instead of a gold font for the team name and dark color for the number . it will include the team's signature "LA" logo on both sides of the shorts for the first time on a core uniform .

title: Who's next for Ilia Topuria, Charles Oliveira, Alexandre Pantoja after UFC 317?
content: former featherweight champion Ilia Topuria knocked out former lightweight champion Charles Oliveira in the UFC 317 title fight . the men's flyweight division took center stage as topuria picked up knockout wins over Alexander Volkanovski and Max Holloway .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Who won and what questions remain after recruiting's busiest month
content: the most active month of the 2026 recruiting cycle is drawing to a close . Florida, Texas and Texas A&M led the charge among the nation's recruiting risers . Alabama, LSU and Ohio State stand among the prominent football powers poised to rise in July .

title: How does a legendary coach move to the college game? Before Bill Belichick, there was Bill Walsh
content: a year into retirement from coaching, a former NBC exec says he would have stayed with the 49ers . he says if he wanted the job, it would have put the franchise on a course that didn't lead to Bill Belichick in 2000 . in doing so, he redirected football history .

title: Grading the Cam Johnson-Michael Porter Jr. trade, plus every major deal this summer
content: a 2032 first-round pick was traded to the Denver Nuggets . the team agreed to trade him to the nets for a new player . he is a combo forward who shot over 39% from 3-point range .

title: NHL free agency big board: Who are the top options available?
content: the salary cap is projected to rise to $95.5 million next season; $104 million in 2026-27 . that could lead to more teams comfortably retaining their own players on expiring contracts . the unrestricted free agent field is organized into different tiers .

title: Carvajal: 'I'll play anywhere' in Xabi's Madrid setup
content: Dani Carvajal says he is ready to play in any position in Xabi Alonso's team . the 33-year-old has been impressed by new coach xabi alonso tactics . defender will play anywhere, even in between the posts, he says .
